docs.summary: Retrieve the products you want to offer your customers and display them.

params.name: cartItems
params.doc: Information about the products offered to the customer.

params.name: eventAggregator
params.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

docs.summary:
Generates the `orderSessionId` and `riskIframeUrl` for an order page that contains 
the specified products. 


After calling this endpoint, you need to forward the response to the 
clientâ€™s URL so that the customer is able to see the order page.

params.name: productTypeId
params.doc:
ID of the [product type](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/product-types/product-type-object)
to retrieve a user offering for.

params.name: msid
params.doc: Metasite ID to retrieve a user offering for.

params.name: eventAggregator
params.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

docs.summary:
Retrieves B2B users information about products that can be provisioned to their sites.
The response includes details about products, associated features and `displayProperties`
for the product type, the products and the features. They're limited to the fields listed
in the `translatable` parameter of the relevant [`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

Eligible products are provided by the reseller management system ('premium-reseller-mgmt'),
which manage the contract of the B2B user with Wix. Only products associated
with the B2B user's contract will be included in the response.

params.name: productId
params.doc: Product ID.

params.name: offeringId
params.doc: ID of the user offering. __Note__: Currently not supported.

docs.summary:
Retrieves pricing and display information for the specified product.


The response of the Get Product Info call includes details about 
the product's pricing and 
[display attributes](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object). 
In contrast, calling the 
[Get Product endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/products/get-product) 
of the Premium Product Catalog V2 API doesnâ€™t return pricing and display 
details, but instead information about coupons and vouchers that are 
associated with the product.

examples.title: Retrieve product information.

params.name: productTypeId
params.doc:
ID of the [product type](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/product-types/product-type-object)
to retrieve a user offering for.

params.name: customOfferingFilters
params.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Optional custom filters that limit which products are returned.
For example, `TLD` for domains.

params.name: productFamilyId
params.doc:
ID of the [product family](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/product-families/product-family-object)
to retrieve a user offering for. If omitted, the user offering is retrieved
for the entire product type.

params.name: country
params.doc:
2-letter country code in
[ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements)
format. The country doesn't affect in which language the `translatable`
display properties are returned. The language of the display text is always
based on the caller's aspects.

Default: The country is calculated from the customer's location that's
based on their IP address.

params.name: msid
params.doc: Metasite ID to retrieve a user offering for.

params.name: existingSubscriptionId
params.doc:
ID of the subscription to upgrade or downgrade.
If omitted, the subscription ID is inferred from the metasite ID.

params.name: eventAggregator
params.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

params.name: currency
params.doc:
3-letter currency code in
[ISO-4217 alphabetic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes)
format.

Default:
+ For upgrades: The currency of the original purchase is used.
+ For initial purchases: The currency is calculated from the customer's location that's based on their IP address.

params.name: biReference
params.doc: Information about what the user has done before calling _Get User Offering_. Premium uses this information for BI purposes.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a user offering for the given product type. If you also specify a
`productFamilyId` only products that belong to this family are included in the
user offering. You can limit the returned products by providing additional
`customOfferingFilters`.


A user offering consists of all products that the customer can purchase,
including billing cycle durations, features, and relevant pricing details.
Note that the currency rate remains fixed. That means, if you set a
product's price at 100 USD with an initial EUR exchange rate of 1.05 USD,
the price for European customers is always 105 EUR. This won't change even
if the EUR-USD exchange rate fluctuates.

In case you havenâ€™t integrated with the 
[Dealer](https://wix-marketing.wixanswers.com/en/article/dealer-faqs), the 
endpoint returns all `PUBLISHED` products of the given product type. Then, 
you may need to add your own filtering before populating the purchase 
funnel pages. This is especially important, if you add products to a 
specific product type after its initial setup.

The response includes `displayProperties` for the product type, the 
products, and the features. But they're limited to the fields listed in the 
`translatable` parameter of the relevant 
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

examples.title: Retrieve a user offering.

params.name: lineItems
params.doc:
Information about the products to user intent to provision.
minSize is 1, maxSize is 10

params.name: countryCode
params.doc: two letters country code for the provisioned products

params.name: eventAggregator
params.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

Provision products and create an active subscription.
Only products associated with the B2B user's contract can be provisioned.

docs.summary:
Checks that the customer hasnâ€™t purchased the same product during the 
last 2 days. This helps prevent unintentional double purchases.

examples.title: Check if the customer has recently purchased a product of the same type.

docs.summary:
A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).
  A boolean feature is similar to a quantitive feature with a default limit of 0 and UNLIMITED premium limit (although a bit simplified).
A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Default (or Freemium) quota limitation. if left undefined the free feature has unlimited amount.

members.name: period
members.doc: Periodic time-frame to reset the usage counter. You may use NO_PERIOD if counter shouldn't be reset.

members.name: units
members.doc: Usage measurement units (seconds? MBs? unitless?). Usage reported will be counted in multiples of this basic unit.

members.name: disclaimerText
members.doc: disclaimer text

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc: ID of the product type to check the recent purchase history for.

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_premium_store_checkout_v1_ValidateNoPreviousPurchaseResponse
messages.displayName: Validate No Previous Purchase Response Object

members.name: status
members.doc:
Information about recent purchases.

+ `UNKNOWN`: Default status, when no information is available.
+ `OK`: You can continue with the purchase. The customer hasn't purchased the same product during the last 2 days.
+ `PENDING`: The customer has started a purchase for the same product during the last 2 days. The purchase is still `PENDING`.
+ `DELIVERED`: The customer has successfully purchased the same product during the last 2 days.
+ `SERVER_ERROR`: The request couldn't be processed beacuse of a server error.

members.doc:
Billing address. Used for the calculation of taxes. If not provided, the
tax is calculated based on `country`.

members.name: useSavedMerchantAddress
members.doc:
Whether to use the customer's location that's saved in the
[Site Properties](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/site-properties/properties/get-site-properties)
is used for the tax calculation. In case you pass
`{"useSavedMerchantAddress":true}` and there is no saved location,
the call fails.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the product type.
Limited to the product type fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: products
members.doc: Available products.

members.name: currencySettings
members.doc: Currency settings.

members.name: displayProperties
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the product type.
Limited to the product type fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.name: currentSubscriptionInfo
members.doc:
Information about the site's current subscription for this product type.
Not available for account level requests.

members.name: purchaseScenario
members.doc:
Information about the response status.

+ `UNAUTHORIZED`: The caller doesn't have the required permission to retrieve an offering.
+ `ACCOUNT_LEVEL`: The customer can purchase the available products on an account-level.
+ `PURCHASE`: The customer can purchase the available products on a site-level.
+ `VIEW`: The customer can only view but not purchase the available products.
+ `EMPTY_OFFERING`: There are no available products for the customer.
+ `ANONYMOUS`: There is no user context to determine the purchase scenario.

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

members.name: offerValidUntil
members.doc:
Time when the offering expires in
[Google protobuf timestamp format](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).
For example, the sale's end date. Available only when the offer has an
expiration date.

members.name: taxSettings
members.doc:
Information about the tax settings for the available products.
Including whether the displayed price includes tax and the type of the tax.
Currently [GST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sales_tax) and
[VAT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Value-added_tax) are supported.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the product type.
Limited to the product type fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the product.
Limited to the product fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.doc:
Product name. Only identical to the `product.name`
that's saved in the
[product catalog](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/products/product-object),
in case there is no display attribute defined for it. Otherwise, the
relevant localized name is retrieved from the
[Display Manager](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/introduction).

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: features
members.doc: Information about the features that are included in the product.

members.name: pricingInfo
members.doc:
Information about the product's pricing. __Note__: Customers might not be
able to choose every billing cycle. For more information see
[purchasable cycles](UPDATE_LINK).

members.name: displayProperties
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the product.
Limited to the product fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.name: purchasableCycles
members.doc:
Information about which billing cycle lengths the customer can purchase.
Initial purchases include all available billing cycle lengths, while
updgrades have a limited selection of available billing cycle lengths.

members.name: disclaimerInfo
members.doc: Information about the disclaimer displayed to the customer.

members.name: cycleDisplayProperties
members.doc:
Information about the display properties for the billing cycles.
For example, if the billing cycle is set to 6 months, you might use
semi-anual as display property.

members.name: sbsProductIdPoc
members.doc:
SBS product ID. __Deprecated__. Will be removed on December 31 2022. For
internal use only in case of generic purchase pages.
Use `productId` instead.

members.name: downgradePurchasableCycles
members.doc:
Information about which billing cycle lengths the customer can
downgrade to.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc: ID of the product type.

members.name: productFamilyId
members.doc: ID of the product family.

members.name: freeTrial
members.doc: the allowed free trial of the product if the user is eligible for it.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about the display properties for the billing cycles.
For example, if the billing cycle is set to 6 months, you might use
semi-anual as display property.

members.name: key:value

Feature name. Only identical to the `feature.name`
that's saved in the

relevant localized name is retrieved from the
[Display Manager](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/introduction).

members.name: excludedCycles
members.doc:
Information about which cycles the feature doesn't apply to. For example,
customers purchasing a subscription with a monthly billing cycle won't
have access to features where `excludedCycles` is set to `MONTHLY`.

members.name: displayProperties
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Information about localized display properties for the feature.
Limited to the feature fields that are listed in the `translatable`
parameter of the
[`displayAttributes` object](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/internal-only/premium/premium-display-manager/display-attributes/product-display-attributes-object).

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc:
Boolean feature. Authorized users have unlimited access to boolean
features.

members.name: quotaFeature
members.doc:
Quota feature. Authorized users have access to quota features that's
limited by the quota.

members.name: cartItems
members.doc: Information about the products offered to the customer.

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

docs.summary:

Additional product information in key:value format.
For example, a campaign ID for Facebook Ads.

members.name: key:value

members.name: cycle
members.doc: Information about the billing cycle.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Quantity of the line item. Currently ignored, because the Dynamic Offering
API doesn't support quantities greater than 1. Only non-Wix products such as
mailboxes may have quantaties greater than 1.

members.name: additionalData
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
Additional product information in key:value format.
For example, a campaign ID for Facebook Ads.

members.name: purchaseType
members.doc: Purchase type.

members.name: couponUsage
members.doc: apply discount coupon to the purchase

members.name: newSubscription
members.doc:
Information about initial purchases. Use only if the customer doesn't
have a current subscription for the product type.

members.name: upgradeSubscription
members.doc: Information about subscription upgrade. __Deprecated__.

members.name: switchContract
members.doc:
Information about a subscription upgrade or downgrade.
Use only if the customer intends to upgrade or downgrade a current
subscription for the product type.

members.name: saleCoupon
members.doc:
Information about a sale coupon to apply.
Use only if there is a configured sale for the relevant product.
Usually, the sale coupon is automatically added.

members.name: userCoupon
members.doc:
Information about a user coupon the customer is awarded when purchasing
the product. Usually, the user coupon is automatically added.

members.name: productCoupon
members.doc:
Information about a product coupon to apply.
Use only in case there is a relevant product coupon.
You must have `PREMIUM.APPLY_COUPONS` permissions to pass a product
coupon. If you provide a `productCoupon`, it overrides an automatically
applied coupon.

members.name: nonCouponUsage
members.doc: Avoid injection of eligible coupons the user might have.

members.name: couponId
members.doc: ID of the user coupon.

members.name: couponCode
members.doc: Code of the product coupon.

members.name: msid
members.doc: ID of the site to assign the new products to.

members.name: existingSubscriptionId
members.doc: ID of the current subscription.

members.name: subscriptionUpgradeType
members.doc: Upgrade type.

members.name: existingSubscriptionId
members.doc: ID of the current subscription.

members.name: contractSwitchType
members.doc:
Type of the contract switch.

+ `CREDIT_UNUSED_PERIOD`: Converts the remaining subscription period into a credit and deducts it from the purchase price.
+ `EXTEND`: Extend the initial billing cycle by the remaining subscription period. Currently not supported.
+ `FULL_AMOUNT_PERIOD`:  Switch immediately to the new subscription without issuing a refund for the remaining subscription period.
+ `DOWNGRADE_RENEWAL`: Switch immediately to the downgraded subscription.

members.name: msid
members.doc:
ID of the site to upgrade or downgrade the subscription for.
Required for account level flows.

members.name: orderSessionId
members.doc:
ID of the order. Used to render the purchase page with
[Premium checkout components](https://github.com/wix-private/checkout-components/tree/master/packages/checkout-components).

members.name: riskIframeUrl
members.doc: URL of iFrame for risk.

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID to create the order page for.
For example, you can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

members.name: subscriptionId
members.doc: ID of the current subscripton.

members.name: cycle
members.doc: Information about the current billing cycle.

members.name: productId
members.doc: ID of the product included in the current subscription.

members.name: productName
members.doc: Name of the current product as stated in the product catalog.

members.name: periodEndDate
members.doc:
End date of the current subscription cycle in
[Google protobuf timestamp format](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

members.name: monthlyPrice
members.doc:
Monthly price of the current subscription in the currency of the purchase.
Use `minorUnits` to determine the correct number of decimal places.

members.name: isBundled
members.doc:
Whether the current subscription is bundled together with a legacy plan
purchase. When `false` the current suscription is its own product. For
example, customers may also receive a subscription for `Ascend` when
purchasing specific Premium Plans. Then, `isBundled` is true for the
`Ascend` plan.

members.name: availableCredit
members.doc:
Credit amount available to the current subscription's owner. Is used to
lower the total charged in the first invoice of the current purchase.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc:
Information about the products to user intent to provision.
minSize is 1, maxSize is 10

members.name: countryCode
members.doc: two letters country code for the provisioned products

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID. Is generated, if you omit it. For example, you
can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

members.name: eventAggregator
members.doc:
Business intelligence ID to create the order page for.
For example, you can use the ID to collect data about how many times the package picker or
checkout page was loaded or a purchase was completed. We recommend to
generate the ID at the beginning of the flow, and then continue using the
same ID throughout the entire flow.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN - unknown interval unit
  • DAY - day
  • WEEK - week
  • MONTH - month
  • YEAR - year

Possible values are:
  • NOT_APPLICABLE
  • REGULAR
  • EU_VAT
  • JAPAN_JCT
  • AU_GST
  • BR_CNPJ
  • RU_TIN
  • IN_RNR
  • IL_VAT
  • US_TAX
  • SG_GST
  • CA_GST
  • CA_HST
  • CA_PST
  • CA_QST
  • NZ_GST
  • MD_VAT
  • CL_VAT
  • MY_VAT
  • KR_VAT
  • TW_VAT
  • AE_VAT
  • NG_VAT
  • IS_VAT
  • GE_VAT
  • TH_VAT
  • TR_VAT
  • NO_VAT
  • UA_VAT
  • IN_GST

Possible values are:
  • NOT_APPLICABLE
  • VAT
  • GST

Determines the reset cycle of the feature usage. Possible values are:
  • NO_PERIOD
  • MILLISECOND
  • SECOND
  • MINUTE
  • HOUR
  • WEEK
  • MONTH
  • YEAR
  • DAY

messages.name: _com_wixpress_premium_store_checkout_v1_ValidateNoPreviousPurchaseTypeEnum_ValidateNoPreviousPurchaseType
messages.displayName: Validate No Previous Purchase Type Object

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • OK - no pending order or delivery exist , valid purchase
  • PENDING - there is open order without delivery , not valid purchase
  • DELIVERED - purchase already delivered
  • SERVER_ERROR - failed to retrieve data from SBS

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • CREDIT_UNUSED_PERIOD - unused subscription period is converted into credit deducted from the purchase price
  • EXTEND - add additional $CYCLE starting at subscription's end date

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • CREDIT_UNUSED_PERIOD - unused subscription period is converted into credit deducted from the purchase price
  • EXTEND - add additional $CYCLE starting at subscription's end date - NOT READY YET
  • FULL_AMOUNT_PERIOD - switch to new subscription immediately with no refund for unused period.
  • DOWNGRADE_RENEWAL - switch to lower subscription (plan or cycle) immediately.

Possible values are:
  • UNAUTHORIZED - user not authorized to purchase in the given account
  • ACCOUNT_LEVEL - account level purchase
  • PURCHASE - site level purchase
  • VIEW - user is permitted to view offering, but not purchase
  • EMPTY_OFFERING - no products available for purchase - this can happen when there are no products in the given offering, or when there is a current subscription, with no upgrade path
  • ANONYMOUS - no logged in user
